intro: Jasione montana subsp. gracilis, commonly known as slender mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or rocky habitats.
